summary: This is a letter from the law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, transmitting Deutsche Bank's thirteenth production of documents in response to a grand jury subpoena dated July 11, 2019. The production includes emails from key bank personnel involved in managing Jeffrey Epstein's accounts and the decisions to onboard and retain him as a client.

persons.name: Parvin D. Moyne
persons.context: Signatory of the letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, transmitting Deutsche Bank's document production to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: James J. Benjamin, Jr.

persons.name: Thomas C. Moyer
persons.context: Signatory of the letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, transmitting Deutsche Bank's document production to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the subject of the grand jury subpoena and the client whose financial relationship with Deutsche Bank is under investigation. The document production includes emails related to managing his accounts.

connections.description: Epstein was a client of Deutsche Bank from at least 2013, with the bank managing his accounts and financial transactions.
Moyne, along with Benjamin and Moyer, are attorneys from Akin Gump representing Deutsche Bank in its response to the grand jury subpoena.
Benjamin is an attorney from Akin Gump representing Deutsche Bank in its response to the grand jury subpoena.
Moyer is an attorney from Akin Gump representing Deutsche Bank in its response to the grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to Deutsche Bank, seeking documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Thirteenth Document Production to SDNY
events.description: Deutsche Bank, through its attorneys at Akin Gump, submitted its thirteenth rolling production of documents in response to the July 2019 subpoena. The production included emails from key bank personnel.

events.title: Concerns Raised About Epstein Relationship
events.description: Internal concerns were raised at Deutsche Bank regarding the bank's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, prompting a decision on whether to maintain him as a client.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was under active grand jury investigation by the SDNY in July 2019 regarding its financial relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

The bank's document production included emails from Epstein's relationship manager (2013-2016) and a Co-Head involved in the decisions to onboard Epstein and retain him after internal concerns were raised in January 2015.

The production was labeled DB-SDNY-PROD013 and contained documents numbered DB-SDNY-0100861 to 0124801, responsive to numerous subpoena requests including account openings, KYC documents, wire transfers, and correspondence.
The letter emphasizes the confidential nature of the production under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e) and asserts that production does not waive any legal privileges.
Key bank personnel involved in managing Epstein's relationship are referenced, but their names are redacted in the provided text excerpt.
